PATIENT_ID: TEST_GERIATRIC_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-13 09:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-13 09:10:00
Category II activation for 78-year-old male. Fall from standing height.
Trauma admission. Age 78.
BP 142/88, HR 86, RR 18, GCS 15.
History of diabetes mellitus and chronic atrial fibrillation.
Arrhythmia documented. On warfarin therapy (anticoagulant, not aspirin).
Past medical history includes cirrhosis and syncope.
Baseline functional status: ambulatory with walker.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-13 09:30:00
CT head: acute subdural hematoma, right frontal region.
CT cervical spine: no acute fracture identified.
CT chest: 4 left-sided rib fractures. Fracture confirmed on imaging.
Imaging confirming multiple qualifying injuries.

[LAB] 2026-02-13 09:20:00
INR 2.8. GFR: 38 mL/min. Creatinine 1.9.
Renal function impaired. GFR < 45.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-13 10:00:00
Geriatric trauma patient meeting qualifying injury criteria:
subdural hematoma and 4 rib fractures.
Medical vulnerability: anticoagulation (warfarin), arrhythmia,
diabetes mellitus, syncope, GFR < 45.
Cardiac history: atrial fibrillation with ejection fraction 35%.
EF: 35%. BMI: 28.
Home medications reconciled. Medication reconciliation completed.
Comorbidities assessed. Medical history reviewed.
Admitted to trauma service.
